Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: கொளற்கரிதாய்க் கொண்டகூழ்த் தாகி அகத்தார் நிலைக்கெளிதாம் நீரது அரண்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: A fort is that which cannot be captured, which abounds in suitable provisions, and affords a position of easy defence to its inmates.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: An enemy army is shown failing completely to capture a fortress. It is simply impossible to take ('கொளற்கரிதாய்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: A cutaway view of the fortress interior reveals vast, overflowing storehouses of food and supplies ('கொண்டகூழ்த்தாகி').
Layered_Composition.Background: The defenders ('அகத்தார்') are shown fighting with ease and confidence from their well-designed battlements. Their position is so advantageous that their defense is easy and sustainable ('நிலைக்கு எளிதாம்').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The ideal fortress has three qualities: it is impossible for the enemy to capture, it is abundantly supplied with provisions, and it provides an easy defensive position for its own soldiers.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The image combines the three key features: the failed external assault, the overflowing internal supplies, and the easy, effective defense.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The outside of the fortress is a scene of chaotic and failed attack. The inside is orderly, abundant, and calm. The colors reflect this contrast.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A dramatic cross-section or diorama-style view that shows the exterior and interior of the fortress simultaneously.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with rich detail in the battle and the fortress interior.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Contrasting light for the exterior chaos and interior order.

Negative_Prompt: fortress being captured, empty storehouses, difficult defensive positions, text artifacts.

Hyperparameters.seed: Explore variations for the overflowing storehouses.
